SHARES Updated Date: 13 December 2024 Chandigarh offers the best of both worlds – a town lifestyle with facilities of a metro. With a population known for its slightly loud, but fine taste, there is no dearth of leisure resorts near Chandigarh, surrounded by the bordering beauty of Himachal Pradesh. The planned city of Chandigarh boasts of excellent accommodation options that ensure a comfortable stay. The resorts near Chandigarh are a great place to chill, revel in natural havens around, enjoy the company of your loved ones, and discover a refreshed self. There is all you could ask for – luxurious spas, forest adventures, hilltop views and more. Timber Trail Resort, Parwanoo We couldn’t have started with any other—Timber Trail Resort is the most popular resort around Chandigarh. It offers an eclectic blend of luxury, beauty and modern amenities, and boasts of stunning scenic views. If you are looking for a quick escape, this is the perfect resort to relax and feel rejuvenated. Kikar Lodge, Nurpur Bedi Forest resorts around Chandigarh are not many. And the one that is there, is 1800-acres huge, warm and luxurious. A good pick for nature lovers, Kikar Lodge is one of the highly recommended jungle resorts near Chandigarh. Distance from Chandigarh: 70 km; 2 hr 20 minutes driveWhat’s special: Pheasants Nest – a multi-cuisine restaurant; The Den – for some quiet recreation; Serenity – the forest spa; candle-light dinner at the amphitheatre; kids pool and play area; and outdoor activities like go-karting.Suggested suite: Forest View CottagesTariff: INR 6,700 per nightWebsite | Reviews Suggested Read: 10 Delightful Boutique Stays For Honeymooners In Himachal 3. Golden Tulip, Morni Hills The Golden Tulip Resort is a four-star luxury resort nestled amidst scenic Morni Hills. This resort around Chandigarh offers state-of-the-art amenities and facilities, and a gorgeous swimming pool. Spend your holidays here at one of the best hill resorts near Chandigarh. Distance from Chandigarh: 18 km; a 30 minutes driveWhat’s special: Breakfast with an amazing view at Patio Terrasse; and relaxing massages at the Ambient Spa.Suggested suite: Luxurious Deluxe Room with 1 King BedTariff: INR 3,200 per nightWebsite | Reviews Suggested Read: Nightlife In Chandigarh: 25 Best Places To Experience Night Scenes Of The City 4. Kasauli Resort, Kasauli Located halfway between Shimla and Chandigarh, the Kasauli Resort showcases the relics of the erstwhile British Raj. Aesthetically designed and decorated resort near Chandigarh ensures an amazing range of services and amenities. Distance from Chandigarh: 55 km; 1 hr 40 minutes driveWhat’s special: Temptations – the English style restaurant with a view; a well-stocked bar; romantic terrace dining; plenty of outdoor and indoor games and activities for kids as well as adults.Suggested suite: Suite Room for a luxurious experience and mesmerizing hill viewTariff: INR 6,200 per nightWebsite | Reviews Suggested Read: 18 Reasons Why I Would Rather Be From Chandigarh Than Anywhere Else In The World 5. Surya Vilas, Solan An eclectic blend of traditionalism with modernity, Surya Vilas offers an opportunity to enjoy the cool mountain air. A comfortable stay and the soulful quietude of the region makes it one of the better rejuvenating holiday resorts. This is also one of the best Chandigarh resorts for booking your stay.  Distance from Chandigarh: 60 km; 1 hr 46 minutes driveWhat’s special: The Himalayan Glamping (luxurious camping) experience, which includes indulgent spas and rejuvenation therapies, mud baths, and facilities like steam, sauna, and jacuzzi.Suggested suite: Glamping Tents; or the Luxury Suite Rooms – the latter are perfect for couples with spoiling offerings like a 4 poster Jakarta bed, open to sky bathroom, a small lounge area, attached heated private swimming pool, and personal butler service.Tariff: INR 10,000 per nightWebsite | Reviews Suggested Read: 15 Best Places To Visit In Himachal Pradesh In December For A Snowy Retreat! Casba Farm Stay, Ajitgarh Run by department of tourism, Casba is a beautiful farm stay resort and also one of the top village resorts near Chandigarh. With lush greenery, guava orchards, and village surrounding it promises a cheerful rural experience for families, especially with kids. Enjoy your getaway here at Casba, one of the best farm resorts near Chandigarh. Distance from Chandigarh: 13 km; 36 minutes driveWhat’s special: An unmatched Punjabi dining experience at the Casba restaurant prepared using organic fresh farm vegetables, in-pool bar and poolside loungers, guava plucking, and evening barbeques.Suggested suite: Luxury Suite, replete with modern facilities and servicesTariff: INR 3,800 per nightWebsite | Reviews Suggested Read: No Kidding, Chandigarh To Shimla In Just 20 Minutes By A Heli Taxi! 7. Aura Vaseela, Mohali Aura Vaseela is a rural heritage resort with a rustic charm. One of the most convenient resorts, it is good for one day outings as well as a weekend getaway. Distance from Chandigarh: 8 km; 22 minutes driveWhat’s special: Authentic Punjabi Cuisines in Hut-K Restaurant and BarSuggested suite: Cottage rooms as they are perfect to experience village charmTariff: INR 2,899 per nightWebsite | Reviews Suggested Read: 15 Resorts In Chandigarh For An Epic Staycation At The Gateway To The Hills! 8. Moksha Himalaya Spa Resort, Parwanoo Amidst the Shivalik Ranges, Moksha Himalaya Spa Resort is the perfect destination to enjoy some quiet time with nature. Best known for its reinvigorating spas and Ayurvedic treatments, this is for your dose of soul meditation. If that’s on your mind, this is the best pick. It is also one of the best resorts near Chandigarh.  Distance from Chandigarh: 35 kms; 1 hr 16 minutes driveWhat’s special: Amazing spa facilities with a wide range of Ayurvedic treatments, Yoga and Meditation, Asian Therapies administered by highly expert masseurs; and the panoramic dining experience at the resort terrace.Suggested suite: Green living is the suite which proves it to be the best luxury resorts near Chandigarh.Tariff: INR 18,000 per nightWebsite | Reviews Further Read: 61 Inviting Places To Visit Near Chandigarh For A Much-Needed Getaway If the images are so good, imagine actually being in these beautiful resorts and enjoying the serene beauty of the surrounding. Frequently Asked Questions About Resorts Near Chandigarh Is it safe to visit the resorts near Chandigarh? Before planning a trip to Chandigarh make sure your Covid-19 vaccination is done as it is only then the chances of you getting infected will be reduced or even if you are infected the harmful effects will be mere. And to answer your question, yet it will be safe to visit the resorts near Chandigarh. But don’t just take our word for it: check up on the latest travel advisory, Covid-19 measures, and the number of cases before your departure. It is safer to undertake solo travel or with a small group of people to somewhere that is not overly crowded at the moment. Is 2 days trip enough for exploring Chandigarh? Chandigarh is a stunning city that has a lot of eminent tourist attractions and you can also have a blast while experiencing the nightlife of the city. If you want to visit all the prime places, cafes and nightclubs then 2 days are enough to make the most out of your trip. How far is Chandigarh from Delhi? If you wish to reach Chandigarh via road, then it will take you approximately 4 hours 45 minutes to reach here from Delhi. As the distance between Delhi to Chandigarh is 246.8 km, from NH 44. Many people prefer to reach Chandigarh via road as the journey is pleasant and it is not that long or tiring. What is Chandigarh famous for? Chandigarh is one of the cleanest cities in India and it is known for its friendly locals, spectacular buildings, greenery, and clean roads and streets. Which is the nearest resort from Chandigarh? There are many great resorts near Chandigarh but if you need a name for the best one then go for Aura Vaseela. It is the nearest resort from Chandigarh and it is situated 8 km away from the city. Which are the best restaurants in Chandigarh? Virgin Courtyard, Dera and Piccante are some of the most famous restaurants that you ought to visit and have a delicious meal on your trip to Chandigarh. What is the best time to visit Chandigarh? If you want to have a pleasant stay in Chandigarh, then you should visit the city between the months of October and March. In these months you can easily explore the city as the weather is not hot.
